result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle W Paul

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Representation, Atty Thomas James represents the Defendant

CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 10/28/2022: Defendant is not to have any VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:16 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Kyle W Paul in court.  Victim A appears in court.

The Court calls the matter for the Victim's Motion to Modify Bail. 
Victim A presents statements and requests for the contact to be "no VIOLENT" contact.
The State objects to any bail modification. 
The Court grants the Victim's A Motion to Modify Bail.
Letter from Atty Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Tapia

Letter dated 10/26/2022, filed by Victim A, requesting a signature bond modification

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/26/2022 - Will address on 11/16.**
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/24/2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:07 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Kyle W Paul in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Kyle W Paul. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
If Victim A would like to address the court as it relates to contact and can not get in front of the trial court, Commissioner Herring will hear a bail motion.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
